metadata.title: CVE-2015-8000 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
db.c in named in ISC BIND 9.x before 9.9.8-P2 and 9.10.x before 9.10.3-P2allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (REQUIRE assertionfailure and daemon exit) via a malformed class attribute.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8000` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.6').
